Prerequisites.title: Prerequisites
Prerequisites.text: Admission to the Integrated Business major.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Emphasizes the relationships between the finance function and other company activities. Focuses on financial statements, cash flow, sources of financing, valuation, inventory and vendor management.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Develops procedure by which start-up businesses can implement a well-researched business model by planning standard business functions necessary to launch the venture.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: How technology and innovation processes affect social and organizational change, and the distinct challenges associated with launching, managing and growing technology-based business ventures.

Prerequisites.title: Prerequisites
Prerequisites.text: Junior standing, application approval, and consent of Management Department.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Supervised, entrepreneurial-related work experience in a sponsoring organization. See Management Department for information. Application required.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Applied course which focuses on the creation, evaluation, development and launch readiness of a new business or social venture.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: This course portrays entrepreneurship as a creative problem solving process emphasizing opportunity recognition, resourcefulness, and leadership that results in startup, social, government and corporate ventures.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Emphasis on understanding how social entrepreneurs effect change in poor communities in the developing world.
